pullRequest.title: Add subscriptions filter
pullRequest.bodyText:
Closes #4263
Add option to hide subscriptions if their counter is zero.

commit.message: Add basic function of Hiding subscriptions where counter is zero

nodes.bodyText: Please use if statements with braces (that's why CI fails)

I would prefer using a normal Preference here and showing the dialog on click. This makes sure that the settings are always presented consistently.
Now we have 3 settings related to subscriptions (order, counter, filter). I think this would look great in a PreferenceCategory called "Subscriptions" (just like "Appearance" category above).
Please make sure to use the same indention as the rest of the file.

nodes.bodyText: Please turn the iteration order around (instead of 0...size to size...0). The reason is that this sometimes skips indices when removing an item. You can therefore end up with feeds that have counter 0 and are still displayed.

I think it would be cool if the message could be displayed above the subscriptions list (directly below the separator line). That way, you do not run into the situation that subscriptions are cut off by the filter message (see screenshot)

The starting point for this change would be NavListAdapter.getSectionDividerView. The dialog can then be shown in NavDrawerFragment.onItemClick.

nodes.bodyText: Could you please move click handling to NavDrawerFragment.onItemClick? All other items of the sidebar are handled in that file. It's also a good practice to keep displaying (adapter) and behavior (click listener) separated. I must admit that this is not always the case in the code base but in this case, it should be pretty easy to do.
